name: Honningbrew Guard

aspects.high_concept: Bored Guard on Pest Control Duty
aspects.trouble: This Job Is Beneath My Training
other_aspects: Would Rather Be Fighting Dragons Than Skeevers

stunts: Shield Wall: +2 to Defend with Fight when using a shield
Watchful Eye: +2 to Notice when on patrol or guard duty
Armor Training: Can ignore 1 shift of Physical stress once per scene due to armor
notes: This guard has been assigned to help with the pest problem at Honningbrew Meadery. He's a competent but unenthusiastic Whiterun guard who feels this duty is beneath him - he joined to fight bandits and protect the hold, not chase skeevers through a basement. He's bored, slightly resentful of the assignment, but professional enough to do his job. He'll help clear the meadery but won't go out of his way to investigate suspicious circumstances unless directly told to do so by a superior. He's typical of Whiterun guards: loyal to the Jarl, competent in basic combat, and more interested in proper threats than pest control.
combat_tactics: Standard guard tactics - shield and sword, defensive positioning, calls for backup if seriously threatened. Against skeevers, he's competent but not enthusiastic. Against real threats, he's professional and effective.
social_interaction: Professional but unenthusiastic. He'll answer questions about the pest problem and his orders, but he clearly thinks this is a waste of his time. He's more interested in talking about 'real' guard work - bandit raids, dragon sightings, the civil war. He'll follow orders and help with the job, but don't expect enthusiasm. He can be friendly in a gruff, warrior-to-warrior way if the PC treats him with respect.

relationships.Sabjorn: Civilian employer for this assignment, cooperative but not close
relationships.PC: Neutral, will treat as ally if PC helps with pest clearing

personality_notes.speaking_style: Gruff, professional, slightly complaining, typical Nord guard
motivations: Complete assignment and return to proper guard duty
Get back to real guard work
fears: Serious injury from a 'mere' skeever infestation would be embarrassing
quirks: Complains about being assigned to pest control
Perks up when discussing real combat
Maintains equipment meticulously despite boring duty
personality_notes.character_growth: None expected - he's a stock guard NPC

story_hooks: Can assist PC in clearing Honningbrew basement
Provides information about Sabjorn's pest problems
May notice suspicious activity if PC points it out
Can be distracted, bribed, or convinced to look the other way
Represents official Whiterun Guard presence at the meadery

dialogue_samples.greeting: You here about the pest problem too? Good. Maybe with help we can clear this place and I can get back to real guard work.
dialogue_samples.complaining: Skeevers. I trained with the Companions' techniques, survived bandit raids, and now I'm hunting rats in a basement.
dialogue_samples.professional: I've got my orders. We clear the pests, secure the meadery, report back to Commander Caius. Simple enough.
dialogue_samples.cooperative: You know how to handle yourself in a fight. Good. Watch your flanks down there - skeevers like to swarm.
dialogue_samples.afterwards: Well, that's done. I'll make my report. If you need anything else, talk to Commander Caius.

dampened_spirits_context.role: Official guard presence for pest clearing
dampened_spirits_context.orders: Help clear skeever infestation, ensure meadery security, report back
dampened_spirits_context.awareness: Doesn't suspect sabotage unless PC or evidence makes it obvious
dampened_spirits_context.flexibility: Will follow PC's lead if they seem competent and help with the job
dampened_spirits_context.authority: Can arrest Mallus if given clear evidence and reason

combat_stats.typical_tactics: Shield wall defense, controlled sword strikes, calls for backup if outnumbered
combat_stats.vs_skeevers: Competent but annoyed, fights defensively to avoid bites
combat_stats.vs_real_threats: Professional and effective, standard guard training
